column1: a step, the act of walking
bright, light, to shine, to see
crane, heron (the one that cries hoarsely)
indeed, at any rate, of course, surely
through, across, beyond, before, in front, first
to become dry; burn, glow; hearth; ashes
to love; desire, covet, want; admire, praise
to make use of, have enjoyment of
to move swiftly, to move upright, to rise (as if to fight)
to move, set in motion; flow, stream (of water); pour, rain; churn
to move, to stir; to rise, spring; quarrel, fight
to own, obtain, come in possession of;
to set in motion, to flow;
to settle down, bed, cozy, familiar
to shake, tremble, agitate; sway, swing; turn, wind
to tear out, dig out, open, acquire
vagina ('the thing near where you sit')
